alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Northern Gila County; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim; White Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 10 at 10:26AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Much of Coconino County, Yavapai County, northern Gila County and far southern Navajo and Apache counties. * WHEN...12 PM MST until 9 PM MST today. * IMPACTS...Flash flooding will be possible in creeks, normally dry washes, swimming holes and over recently burned areas. Low-water crossings could also experience flash flooding, which would create deadly travel conditions. Consider changing your plans if you were going to hike, boat, or paddleboard to a slot canyon or normally dry wash. If you do still decide to recreate, check in at a nearby visitor center or ranger station. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
